page.title: 12PENRITH SEWAGE WORKS.
page.content: Situated 1 km east of Penrith in the Eamont valley.The works operate an Alternate Double {Filtration system;}a Comminuter to remove rags; a Dorr Detritor to remove gravel; 2 horizontal flow sedimentation tanks; 6 brick built circular biological filters; and 2 circular humus tanks. A filter press with Aluminium Chlorohydrate conditioning dries the sludge, which is used as fertiliser. 2 men operate all the machinery. The works cater for a population of ll,5OO, plus road drainage plus Trade Effluent from expanding industrial estates. Average daily flow is l million galls. 3 million is accepted. From 3 to 6 million is diverted to storm tanks- excess diverted straight to the river.
